intro: Nephromeria, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lobed or deeply cut, and they produce yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. Nephromeria species are often found in grasslands and open areas, and they are adapted to dry conditions. The genus is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive leaf morphology.
